title: How to Use an Online Random Number Generator to Do Poker Simulations

steps.headline: Learn and play Texas hold' em.
steps.description: For real money, play on the lowest limit. When using play money, remember that in a real game, a rake of about five percent is taken from each pot. #  After playing the game, do simulations, to improve your game. There many ways to improve your game, simulations can be done for free online or with a deck of cards.

steps.headline: Do a  simulation with aces because many beginners play any ace.
This simulation is useful because hold' em is played high and not high/low, there are no wild cards, the ace is the highest card.
steps.description: The results of this simulation can be applied to other cards like kings or queens, because there are four kings and queens.

steps.headline: Initially use a deck of cards to do simulations.
steps.description: Although this is a slow way to do simulations, many old-time players used this method.

steps.headline: Use a deck of cards to recognize ratios (odds) in later studies.
steps.description: Cards are superior to poker software for this.

steps.headline: For the first simulation, do a statistical study of the distribution of aces in a game for 8 players.
steps.description: There are many distributions of aces studies that can be done, so choose one that you think will be useful. For example, if you normally play in a game with about 8 players, choose 8 players as your first study. In this example, you have an ace and another card as your hole cards and the flop has an ace, tabulate what the other 7 players at the table have in term of aces.

steps.headline: Think of all possible outcomes of a simulation before starting.
steps.description:
In this example the outcomes are:
No one has an ace,
One person has an ace,
Two people have an ace, and
On person has 2 aces.

steps.headline: List the outcomes in the order, that you think, the results will be from large to small.
steps.description: By doing this, not only will you have good use of your paper, but you will realize that the results will be different from what you thought they would be. From the results, you will have an advantage over players who only play and guess.

steps.headline: After shuffling, dealing out, and recording the results of a couple hundred deals, stop.
steps.description: Add the totals and assign percentages to the outcomes. Repeat this for 6 players, because very often the number of players in an eight player game fluctuates.

steps.headline: Make a summary of the simulation results.
steps.description: For this simulation, a conclusion is that your kicker is important since there is a 52% chance that a player(s) has an ace(s). This is mostly true, since poker is a complex game, the outcome depends on other factors as position, how many players are left in the hand, split pot rules etc. A broader conclusion is that you should do many more simulations

steps.headline: After spending hours doing simulations, think about the essence of what you are doing and how you could do it faster.
steps.description: The essence is that you are concerned with either aces or non-aces. In a deck of cards there are 4 aces and 48 non-aces.

steps.headline: Start using an online random number integer generator to do this simulation.
steps.description: Assign the numbers from 1 and 4 as aces and 5 to 52 as non-aces. Already accounted for are: 2 aces and 3 non-aces. Set the random number generator to produce numbers, from 3 to 49, in separate groups of 14, since you want to see the 2 hole cards of the other seven players. The first and  second numbers are the hole cards of player 1, the third and fourth numbers are the hole cards of player 2, the fifth and sixth cards are the hole cards or player 3, etc. This is faster than using cards. There are other creative ways to use a random number generator.

steps.headline: Later, do this simulation for 6, 4, and 2 players.
steps.description: Do simulations for other distributions like straights, flushes, pocket pairs, pre flop, fourth street etc.

steps.headline: After much thought and study on this method and randomness, improve your way of using data from the random number generator.
steps.description: Buy a good poker software, one that you can create conditions like from Wilson Software. Learn how to write programs to do these simulations.

steps.headline: Look beyond the name of a game, and use the games that comes with Windows like hearts to take statistics.

text:
Learn and play Texas hold' em. For real money, play on the lowest limit. When using play money, remember that in a real game, a rake of about five percent is taken from each pot. #  After playing the game, do simulations, to improve your game. There many ways to improve your game, simulations can be done for free online or with a deck of cards. Do a  simulation with aces because many beginners play any ace.  This simulation is useful because hold' em is played high and not high/low, there are no wild cards, the ace is the highest card. The results of this simulation can be applied to other cards like kings or queens, because there are four kings and queens. Initially use a deck of cards to do simulations. Although this is a slow way to do simulations, many old-time players used this method. Use a deck of cards to recognize ratios (odds) in later studies. Cards are superior to poker software for this. For the first simulation, do a statistical study of the distribution of aces in a game for 8 players. There are many distributions of aces studies that can be done, so choose one that you think will be useful. For example, if you normally play in a game with about 8 players, choose 8 players as your first study. In this example, you have an ace and another card as your hole cards and the flop has an ace, tabulate what the other 7 players at the table have in term of aces. Think of all possible outcomes of a simulation before starting. In this example the outcomes are:
No one has an ace,
One person has an ace,
Two people have an ace, and
On person has 2 aces. List the outcomes in the order, that you think, the results will be from large to small. By doing this, not only will you have good use of your paper, but you will realize that the results will be different from what you thought they would be. From the results, you will have an advantage over players who only play and guess. After shuffling, dealing out, and recording the results of a couple hundred deals, stop. Add the totals and assign percentages to the outcomes. Repeat this for 6 players, because very often the number of players in an eight player game fluctuates. Make a summary of the simulation results. For this simulation, a conclusion is that your kicker is important since there is a 52% chance that a player(s) has an ace(s). This is mostly true, since poker is a complex game, the outcome depends on other factors as position, how many players are left in the hand, split pot rules etc. A broader conclusion is that you should do many more simulations After spending hours doing simulations, think about the essence of what you are doing and how you could do it faster. The essence is that you are concerned with either aces or non-aces. In a deck of cards there are 4 aces and 48 non-aces. Start using an online random number integer generator to do this simulation. Assign the numbers from 1 and 4 as aces and 5 to 52 as non-aces. Already accounted for are: 2 aces and 3 non-aces. Set the random number generator to produce numbers, from 3 to 49, in separate groups of 14, since you want to see the 2 hole cards of the other seven players. The first and  second numbers are the hole cards of player 1, the third and fourth numbers are the hole cards of player 2, the fifth and sixth cards are the hole cards or player 3, etc. This is faster than using cards. There are other creative ways to use a random number generator. Later, do this simulation for 6, 4, and 2 players. Do simulations for other distributions like straights, flushes, pocket pairs, pre flop, fourth street etc. After much thought and study on this method and randomness, improve your way of using data from the random number generator. Buy a good poker software, one that you can create conditions like from Wilson Software. Learn how to write programs to do these simulations. Look beyond the name of a game, and use the games that comes with Windows like hearts to take statistics.
